oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Bishop's Cumberland Minstrel Show
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bishop's Cumberland Minstrel Show photograph. Inscription on the back reads: "Bishops Cumberland Minstrels, Chattanooga, Tennessee, 1864." Thomas Brigham Bishop was born June 29, 1835, in Wayne, Maine. At the age of 16, he began studying music. He ran a; minstrel show in Chattanooga, Tenn., from about April 1864 until just after Lincoln was assassinated a year later. Bishop is credited with composing many famous songs. In later life, he ran a "bucket shop" in New York. Bishop died on May 15, 1905.
